data.prayer: Jesus, please raise up evangelists to equip your people to share the gospel in Sembabule.
data.verse: So Christ himself gave the apostles, the prophets, the evangelists, the pastors and teachers, to equip his people for works of service, so that the body of Christ may be built up

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Sembabule, Uganda
data.section_summary: What conditions of religion or environment could you pray for here?

data.prayer: Father, move the 1,459 believers in the state of Sembabule to say "Not our will, but yours be done", like Jesus.
data.verse: He withdrew about a stone’s throw beyond them, knelt down and prayed, "Father, if you are willing, take this cup from me; yet not my will, but yours be done."

data.prayer: Father, remind your church in Sembabule, Uganda that you have set your Son over all rule and authority, power and dominion, and every name that is invoked.
data.verse: he raised Christ from the dead and seated him at his right hand in the heavenly realms, far above all rule and authority, power and dominion, and every name that is invoked, not only in the present age but also in the one to come.

data.prayer: Lord, let it be said of the 2,941 lost in Sembabule that you have called them out of darkness into your glorious light.
data.verse: But you are a chosen race, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people for God’s own possession, that you may proclaim the excellence of him who called you out of darkness into his marvelous light

data.prayer: Spirit, I pray that the Gujarati people will come and worship before you, Lord. May they glorify your name for you are great.
Spirit, give the believers of the the state of Sembabule unity and humility as they work to bring the kingdom to new people and places.
Father, let the threatened of Sembabule, Uganda know that it is better to trust in you than to trust in humans.
data.verse: It is better to take refuge in the Lord than to trust in humans.

data.prayer: Good Shepherd, thank you that you know the name of each of the 1,459 believers in Sembabule.
data.verse: I am the good shepherd; I know my sheep and my sheep know me

location.name: Sembabule
location.people_groups_list: Mvuba, Plains Bira, Nyang'i, Arab, Lebanese, Hindi
location.people_groups_list_w_pop: Mvuba (1,200), Plains Bira (2,000), Nyang'i (18,000), Arab, Lebanese (15,000), Hindi (5,800)
